<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/e974fa7b2b98e53a59d5ef16a6a1291f12a32e33|patch 8.2.1902: default option values changed with :badd for existing…>
patch 8.2.1902: default option values changed with :badd for existing buffer

Problem:    Default option values are changed when using :badd for an existing
            buffer.
Solution:   When calling buflist_new() pass a zero line number. (closes #7195)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1902: default option values changed with :badd for existing… · vim/vim@e974fa7
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1902: default option values changed with :badd for existing… · vim/vim@e974fa7
attachments.text: … buffer Problem: Default option values are changed when using :badd for an existing buffer. Solution: When calling buflist_new() pass a zero line number. (closes #7195)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/4ff2f2fb6bef01a06bd726bae8dfa8dd6355d594|patch 8.2.1901: variable completion does not work in command line window>
patch 8.2.1901: variable completion does not work in command line window

Problem:    Variable completion does not work in command line window.
Solution:   Use the "prevwin". (closes #7198)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1901: variable completion does not work in command line window · vim/vim@4ff2f2f
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1901: variable completion does not work in command line window · vim/vim@4ff2f2f
attachments.text: Problem: Variable completion does not work in command line window. Solution: Use the "prevwin". (closes #7198)

patch 8.2.1900: Vim9: command modifiers do not work

Problem:    Vim9: command modifiers do not work.
Solution:   Make most command modifiers work.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/67def64a4e4590a5f3b55ebfc33c42a3dcd7b559|patch 8.2.1899: crash in out-of-memory situation>
patch 8.2.1899: crash in out-of-memory situation

Problem:    Crash in out-of-memory situation.
Solution:   Bail out if shell_name is NULL. (Dominique Pellé, closes #7196)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1899: crash in out-of-memory situation · vim/vim@67def64
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1899: crash in out-of-memory situation · vim/vim@67def64
attachments.text: Problem: Crash in out-of-memory situation. Solution: Bail out if shell_name is NULL. (Dominique Pellé, closes #7196)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/e10044015841711b989f9a898d427bcc1fdb4c32|patch 8.2.1898: command modifier parsing always uses global cmdmod>
patch 8.2.1898: command modifier parsing always uses global cmdmod

Problem:    Command modifier parsing always uses global cmdmod.
Solution:   Pass in cmdmod_T to use.  Rename struct fields consistently.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1898: command modifier parsing always uses global cmdmod · vim/vim@e100440
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1898: command modifier parsing always uses global cmdmod · vim/vim@e100440
attachments.text: Problem: Command modifier parsing always uses global cmdmod. Solution: Pass in cmdmod_T to use. Rename struct fields consistently.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5661ed6c833e05467cab33cb9b1c535e7e5cc570|patch 8.2.1897: command modifiers are saved and set inconsistently>
patch 8.2.1897: command modifiers are saved and set inconsistently

Problem:    Command modifiers are saved and set inconsistently.
Solution:   Separate parsing and applying command modifiers.  Save values in
            cmdmod_T.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1897: command modifiers are saved and set inconsistently · vim/vim@5661ed6
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1897: command modifiers are saved and set inconsistently · vim/vim@5661ed6
attachments.text: Problem: Command modifiers are saved and set inconsistently. Solution: Separate parsing and applying command modifiers. Save values in cmdmod_T.
